page.title: 20 Polstead,a child's poems.
page.content:
Bubble-gum,jaw-breakers,lollipops, fizz-bombs, At the Community Shop. Bitz,Yorkie,Twix,Mars, At the Community Shop. Say Cheese-Walkers,Snips,Waffles, At the Community Shop. Cokes,Pepsi,Tango,Top-Deck, At the Community Shop. Cream,whipped,single,and there's milk, At the Community Shop.
In the Horsecroft we make drays, We play Hide-and-seek. In the Summer it is long, In the Winter it is short, So it is good. I made a dray,used five bales, It was huge I could fit five people in. It had some cars,a gun and a toy CB, That's the joy of living in the country By Joshua Benham aged 8 years.
